abstract.text: Returns the double-precision element-wise product of the sum of two vectors and a scalar value.

inlineContent.text: A tuple that contains the vectors
This function calculates the element-wise sum of vectors
, multiplies the sum by scalar value
, and writes the result to vector

media-4383295.alt: A diagram showing the operation of this function. There are four rows. The top row represents the input vectors, A and B, with three boxes of each. The second row represents the operation that adds A to B, with three boxes, as well as the input scalar C with one box. The third row represents the multiplication operation as three boxes. The bottom row represents the output vector D as three boxes. The diagram has connecting lines from the input vectors to the operations, and from the operations to the output vector.
